newsitem.title: UK: British Airways to sell US Airways stake.
newsitem.headline: British Airways to sell US Airways stake.

text.p: British Airways said on Wednesday its wholly-owned subsidiary, BritAir Acquisition Corp Inc., had agreed to sell its remaining investment in US Airways Group for $499 million.
The company said Goldman Sachs & Co would handle the sale of the 14.46 million shares of common stock at $34.50 per share.
"This is an excellent deal for British Airways and its shareholders," BA chief executive Bob Ayling said in a statement.
"It realises the potential of the deal we struck with US Air four years ago and completes the disposal of our investment."
British Airways said it will receive $625 million from the sale of its entire equity interest in US Airways which it acquired for $401 million.

Under the share repurchase plan announced on Tuesday, US Airways said it will buy back from BA all the outstanding Series T-1 and Series T-2 preferred stock and a portion of the Series F preferred stock.
